expected_answer: 60% subsidy (Rs. 75,000 per hectare out of total unit cost of Rs. 1,25,000)
ground_truth_context: MIDH provides 60% subsidy in Year 1 for area expansion, which amounts to Rs. 75,000 per hectare

evaluation_criteria.completeness: Should reference the total unit cost
evaluation_criteria.relevance: Must be specific to MIDH Year 1

expected_answer: 5% of the sum insured (with government covering the remaining 95%)

query: What is the annual PM-KISAN benefit amount?
expected_answer: Rs. 6,000 per year, disbursed in 3 installments of Rs. 2,000 each
ground_truth_context: PM-KISAN provides Rs. 6,000 annually in quarterly installments

query: How can an SC/ST farmer in Telangana maximize subsidies for a 2-hectare mosambi plantation?
expected_answer: SC/ST farmers in Telangana can combine: (1) MIDH 60% subsidy (Rs. 1,50,000), (2) PMKSY 100% drip irrigation subsidy (Rs. 1,20,000), (3) PM-KISAN Rs. 6,000/year, (4) YSR Annadatha Rs. 18,000/year, (5) NREGA convergence for labor (Rs. 30,000), totaling approximately Rs. 3,24,000 in Year 1
ground_truth_context: Multiple schemes can be converged for maximum benefit including MIDH, PMKSY, PM-KISAN, state schemes, and NREGA

evaluation_criteria.correctness: Must mention at least 3-4 major schemes
evaluation_criteria.relevance: Specific to SC/ST and Telangana context

query: What are the eligibility requirements for MIDH area expansion subsidy?
expected_answer: Key requirements: (1) Land ownership or 10-year lease deed, (2) Assured year-round irrigation, (3) No previous MIDH benefit in last 5 years, (4) Priority for SC/ST/women/small farmers, (5) Water source certification
ground_truth_context: MIDH has specific eligibility criteria including land ownership, irrigation, and prior benefit verification

evaluation_criteria.correctness: Must mention land and irrigation requirements

query: What is the complete cost breakdown for establishing 1 hectare of mosambi plantation under MIDH?
expected_answer: Total cost Rs. 1,25,000 includes: Plant material Rs. 16,500 (275 plants), Soil preparation Rs. 8,000, Organic manures Rs. 20,000, Fertilizers Rs. 25,000, Bio-fertilizers Rs. 5,000, Mulching Rs. 12,000, Pesticides Rs. 18,000, Labor Rs. 15,000, Micro irrigation Rs. 5,500
ground_truth_context: MIDH unit cost breakdown shows detailed component-wise costs for plantation

evaluation_criteria.completeness: Should list at least 5-6 major components
